It's soooo sad. I get max. 2 hours</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2309785"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2309785#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309749" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2309749" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahcake22"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280028"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahcake22" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2309749ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2309749" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2280028">sarahcake22</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-09">10/09/24 03:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mellow citrus opening, not tart or sharp citrus, almost like a lemon whipped cream. After some time you get a fresh/spicy intimate vanilla scent, skin scent almost- but not quite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2309749"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2309749#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2309102" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2309102" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="byrehoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577248"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1577248.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="byrehoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jouissance/En-Plein-Air-98080.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.98080.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="En Plein Air"title="En Plein Air"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2309102ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2309102" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1577248">byrehoe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 12:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The most darling little lemon tart and a soft sandalwood hug. The juniper and pine ground it from being overly saccharine, but its still a high calorie fragrance. At the heart is a custardy, golden vanilla. If it didnt cost a fortune, I feel like Glizzy Water would be as safe a blind buy as you could get. Sweet, but not cloying. Woodsy, without straying into Yuletide. (IMHO the hand cream smells exactly like the fragrance and makes the most indulgent party favour). Blink-and-it's-gone lifespan on skin for me, but itll shyly cling to fabric for a whole workday. <br />
<br />
Mental Snapshot: A golden Maxfield Parrish forest on the cusp of autumn, tinkling laughter drifting through the rustle of leaves. You chalk it up to your imagination until you stumble upon the tiniest picnic, hosted high in a robins nest. A gnomish maiden excitedly offers you the most generous cut of her fabled sunberry pie. (The whole pie is the size of your thumbnail). You venture onwards delighted, but not exactly sated.<br />
<br />
tl;dr: lemon petit four </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2309102"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2309102#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2308963" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2308963" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jeremjoe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134586"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2134586.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jeremjoe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2308963ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2308963" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2134586">Jeremjoe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-08">10/08/24 10:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells good, versatile, doesn't last long</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2308963"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2308963#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2306545" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2306545" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fonna2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/653862"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.653862.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fonna2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Organza-4.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Organza"title="Organza"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2306545ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2306545" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/653862">Fonna2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-06">10/06/24 04:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Got a sample of this because it sounded interesting.  I didn't bother with the notes, and I  usually do not look at the notes before I write a review.  After teeter tottering if I liked it or not on myself, I decided to just break down notes I smell,  and give it a proper review.<br />
I sprayed this in my bathroom,  leaving it to morph. At first, the initial scent is a citrusy,  windexy,  piney,  fruity fuzzy smell. Almost like someone doing some house cleaning next to a big bowl full of fruit.  <br />
I liked (not loved)   thAt part of it. Then, this happens about one hour later.....<br />
<br />
 Expensive smoky very sweet pipe tobacco next to a piney wood pile. And it just keeps going, and going with a silage that just keeps going because I didn't even have to go into my bathroom, the scent.....  it is in the kitchen!!  That's a food 50 feet or more!<br />
Is a  'brawny'  type lumber jack man in my bathroom smokin' a pipe?  I don't know. but it  sure smells like there is! Lol<br />
<br />
I'm not liking it. Not for me and I'm not sure I'd like it on a guy.  Too sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2306545"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2306545#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2305908" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2305908" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sleepiestgirlinthevalley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2076924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sleepiestgirlinthevalley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2305908ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2305908" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2076924">sleepiestgirlinthevalley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-10-05">10/05/24 12:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>incredibly impressive that the juniper berries don't make me gag from the gin association (it's a weakness i know); in my notebook when first reviewing this i wrote that it wasn't swoon-worthy but pretty and calming in the way a foggy day is. it still smells like an imagined yet very accurate interpretation of foggy weather to me and i'm not sure if that's because of some memory i have or if others would agree. i won't take back the comment about it not being swoon-worthy, but i'll say it definitely doesn't need to be. it's just really really.. nice and sometimes that's what i need. like a sigh. i got a full bottle because i like being comforted</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2305908"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2305908#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2299957" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2299957" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yareno"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2265557"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2265557.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="yareno" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/MYSLF-Eau-de-Parfum-84094.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.84094.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="MYSLF Eau de Parfum"title="MYSLF Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2299957ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2299957" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2265557">yareno</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-30">09/30/24 07:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When you first spray it, it smells like lemon cologne, very clean and fresh. As time passes, the scent becomes even more pleasant, making it perfect for daily use and suitable for all seasons. In terms of longevity, Id say its average. It's noticeable in the first few hours, but after 5-6 hours, it leaves a light trace on the skin.<br />
<br />
Its a great option for those who enjoy light and natural scents, reflecting the freshness of nature. Its also one of my favorite fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2299957"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2299957#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2299404" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2299404" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eliegg"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2249908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="eliegg" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2299404ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2299404" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2249908">eliegg</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-29">09/29/24 17:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought i would really like this one. The name, brand identity and everything seemed so perfect but i just dont get it. At the byredo store, on paper this smells like Creed silver mountain water, but not quite as good and more nondescript. I ended up getting a sample because the hype regarding this fragrence.<br />
<br />
Oh dear was i shocked when i put it on my skin. The opening is again, like a underwhelming version of creed SMW, but its still pleasant, airy, light and almost icy. After 1-3 minuets it turns to cheap fruit-scented craylola washable markers. Im not kidding this smells like plastic, wax, mixed with cheap, synthetic fruit. I get some synthetic vaniila at the base and some incense after ~10 minuets, by 15 minutes its gone. <br />
decent projection for the first 1 minuet, then none.<br />
Im not sure what im missing. Maybe this will grow on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2299404"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2299404#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2297913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; With that being said I would absolutely love this scent on a woman.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2297913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2297913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2297354" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2297354" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LaSauvignonBlonde"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2205116"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2205116.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LaSauvignonBlonde" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diptyque/Benjoin-Boheme-40942.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.40942.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Benjoin Bohme"title="Benjoin Bohme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2297354ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2297354" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2205116">LaSauvignonBlonde</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-27">09/27/24 17:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im getting top notes of citrus  <br />
followed by a procession of juniper  <br />
and creamy blonde sandalwood.  <br />
This smells a lot like Tam Dao, but its not so linear. I dont smell any specific floral notes but somehow the composition *feels* floral. The citrus is more pronounced but not overwhelming; it just brightens things up a bit. Ultimately, the fragrance never wanders too far away from its woodsy core. <br />
 I would eagerly add this to my collection if not for the poor sillage. This fragrance doesnt project more than an inch away from my skinwhich is pretty disappointing.<br />
<br />
Scent imagery: A wooden gazebo, sunbeams, secondhand incense clinging to fabric, a wild meadow, and gin cocktails garnished w/ honeysuckle</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; I don't even know how this smells like</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2296711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2296711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2295030" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2295030" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JJ2137"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JJ2137" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2295030ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2295030" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1882714">JJ2137</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-25">09/25/24 15:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells great, but notes here are kinda misleading, I expected coniferous vibes, and for me this smells like orange creamsicle. After it settles, it reminds me of Nishane Ani a little bit, the same type of spices-citrus-vanilla frame.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2295030"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2295030#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2294351" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2294351" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="gymnopedie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242212"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="gymnopedie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Love-Don-t-Be-Shy-4322.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4322.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Don't Be Shy"title="Love Don't Be Shy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2294351ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2294351" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1242212">gymnopedie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-25">09/25/24 02:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this and Mojave ghost started out as scents that I could BARELY, and I mean barely, smell at all, even if I sprayed it on a strip and rubbed it under my nose. I figured out that was because the only other fragrances I had smelled up until then were stuff from houses like Dior, Mugler, YSL etc, essentialy very strong, easy to make out, "perfumey" scent's. Once I (unintentionally) took a long break from both wearing and sniffing perfumes, and came back to GW and MG, I could suddently smell them in their full glory, and started percieving these other perfumes as being way too overpowering choke-hazards. Kindof like with sugar addiction, once you beat it suddenly you taste other things better and a lot of sugary food is too sweet. Now when I spray this, I smell all the notes and I can smell it on me all day.<br />
Either your stronger scent's are making you noseblind, or your nosebuds need time to adjust to pick up on the nuances of scent's like this one. Or youre just outta luck, unfortunately.This stuff is amazing, and get's me compliments.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2294351"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2294351#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2292620" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2292620" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Renardz"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2235112"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2235112.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Renardz" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Un-Bois-Vanille-478.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.478.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Un Bois Vanille"title="Un Bois Vanille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2292620ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2292620" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2235112">Renardz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-23">09/23/24 11:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Refreshing soft citrus, gently sweet vanilla-sandal base and magical ethereal pine. It's everything I love, and I absolutely adore it. But why, why is it so weak? <br />
It lasts, but it's so light that projection is about non-existant. I'm not into high projection at all since I'm quite sensitive to smells, but Gypsy Water is too light even for me. <br />
From reviews I got that if I leave it to macerate for some prolonged amount of time it will grow a bit in intensity. Really hope it helps</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2292620"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2292620#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2292437" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2292437" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Melody Valentine"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Melody Valentine" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Love-Don-t-Be-Shy-4322.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4322.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love Don't Be Shy"title="Love Don't Be Shy"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2292437ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2292437" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1747732">Melody Valentine</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-23">09/23/24 08:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This would be lovely if It was 100x stronger. It smells like a Mr Kipling lemon slice cake but with a woody, aromatic, slightly powdery dry down. I like it and I usually hate fresh, citrusy scents. I think of things like Light Blue by D and G but this isn't like that. The incense, orris, vanilla, sandalwood and amber make it more interesting and a really nice summery perfume. Like someone else said, it's a proper white t-shirt and jeans sort of perfume but I also see it working with a leather mini dress. Very much a cool girl scent as it's quite unisex smelling and would work just as well on a man. It's a shame it lasts for less than half an hour. It becomes a total skin scent within mins* Maybe it'll perform better in hot weather. It could work really well for layering I suppose, on top of a simple vanilla, amber or sandalwood scent. I'm gonna try it with Gentle Fluidity Gold, they share juniper, amber and vanilla notes so could work really well.<br />
<br />
*It becomes less than a skin scent within minutes, it's gone entirely. Unless I've gone noseblind but I don't think I have since loads of other people have said the same thing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2292437"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2292437#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2291547" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I would NEVER, EVER buy a niche fragrance for hundreds of bones that has a flimsy plastic cap. Are you kidding?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2291341"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2291341#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2287801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2287801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AngryPorpoise"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2259201"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2259201.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AngryPorpoise" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2287801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2287801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2259201">AngryPorpoise</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-19">09/19/24 03:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Really amazing scent hampered by sad performance. The scent itself has a bit of that magic quality to it, it's somehow fresh without going too far and then softly sweet in a real balanced way that is just other-worldly. But you really wont be noticing it much if at all and its just overall very weak.<br />
<br />
Super sad, seems like all the best scents in the frag world simply don't last :(<br />
Would still sample just so you can see why it's so hyped.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2287801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2287801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2283334" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2283334" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="csirip"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253385"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2253385.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="csirip" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2283334ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2283334" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2253385">csirip</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-15">09/15/24 02:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first the citruses hit me, then the vanilla came through. After a little time it turns more spicy (maybe cardamom?), incensy, fresh. As it evolved, it turned too spicy for my taste.  Funny that the spiciness bothered me, because this is so weak, sometimes I could hardly smell it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2283334"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2283334#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2282319" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2282319" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dabatch"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112358"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1112358.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dabatch" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mercedes-Benz/Mercedes-Benz-Sign-Your-Attitude-75488.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75488.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Mercedes-Benz Sign Your Attitude"title="Mercedes-Benz Sign Your Attitude"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2282319ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2282319" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1112358">dabatch</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-14">09/14/24 04:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>for a 130e fragrance it absurdly lacks any performance. any.<br />
4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2282319"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2282319#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2276910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cristinaaa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260031"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1260031.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cristinaaa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-des-Ors/Lune-Feline-29716.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29716.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Lune Feline"title="Lune Feline"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2276910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2276910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260031">Cristinaaa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-09">09/09/24 08:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The magic of this fragrance lies in the sillage. At first spray, I perceived a watery pine note with some incense and spices. I did not understand the hype and was unimpressed. As the day progressed, I kept getting wafts of something clean and powdery. It went from bland citrus pine to chic and understated. I love when a fragrance surprises me like this. The scent does not project massively  and would be ideal for work/gym/school.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2276910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2276910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2276188" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2276188" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bkingstar"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2219962.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bkingstar" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2276188ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2276188" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2219962">bkingstar</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-08">09/08/24 14:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its good but nothing groundbreaking or incredible. Its a warm, woody citrus scent that would work really well in fall/winter. It dries down to a very intimate, close to the skin scent that I enjoy much more than the initial spray. Whats turning me off to this is that the lemon note reminds me of cleaning products</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2276188"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2276188#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2271775" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Kinda like pine needles and vanilla.  I can't imagine offending anyone with this however there's a dusty aspect here that my nose does not vibe with. I also don't love the fact that I really can't smell this without shoving my nose in my wrist.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2271775"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2271775#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270869" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Worthy of signature fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2270611"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2270611#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270604" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2270604" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="diortears"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2090850"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2090850.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="diortears" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2270604ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2270604" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2090850">diortears</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-03">09/03/24 17:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Imagine yourself on an endless road, with the warm wind and fresh scent of the surrounding trees embracing you. The initial notes of lemon and juniper bring the sensation of a refreshing dip in a river, while pepper adds a hint of adventure, like an unexpected trail in the middle of nature.<br />
<br />
As the fragance evolves, there are chords of incense and pine. With this comes the freedom to explore the unknown. <br />
<br />
The scents are extremely natural and not at all synthetic</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2270604"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2270604#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2270084" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2270084" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="EmmaMartha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506352"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1506352.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="EmmaMartha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aerin/Cedar-Violet-68959.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68959.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cedar Violet"title="Cedar Violet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2270084ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2270084" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1506352">EmmaMartha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-03">09/03/24 07:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells good but no projection and after 15 minutes you have to really press your nose to your skin to smell it.<br />
<br />
To me it smells almost like a clean new leather jacket. Slightly fresh, with a citrus undertone. <br />
<br />
Definitely not worth the price tag unfortunately.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2270084"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2270084#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2269861" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2269861" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mizi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/123368"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mizi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2269861ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2269861" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/123368">Mizi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-09-03">09/03/24 03:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spicy powdery lemon/bergamot. Not really peppery but rather fresh as in pine/juniper spicy. Quite neutral neither feminine nor masculine. I get a soft whiff of incense on the dry down and lemony/vanillic creaminess. A Super pleasant scent, all year rounder, any occasion (if your goal is to seduce on a date go for something else), work appropriate. Probably full bottle worthy if you have nothing else like it.<br />
Update: I caved in :D</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2269861"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2269861#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2268398" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2268398" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Marie76"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/138192"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.138192.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Marie76" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Estee-Lauder/Tender-Light-69708.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69708.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Tender Light"title="Tender Light"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2268398ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2268398" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); Hotel lobby. Beautiful, clean, a bit aloof. I found it disappointing that it lasted only a couple of hours on me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2268398"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2268398#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2266640" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259457" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LawmaLlama"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1184712"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1184712.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LawmaLlama" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/Goddess-83483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.83483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Goddess"title="Goddess"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259457ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259457" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8); Extremely subtle and pleasant, but essentially comes across as a post shower body spray. Purchased a trio set of Byredo dabbers to try this. Not one is special or worth the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2259457"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2259457#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2259219" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2259219" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jetpack"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2230006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2230006.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jetpack" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2259219ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2259219" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2230006">Jetpack</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-24">08/24/24 03:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Its a simple and pleasant fragrance that feels familiar and comforting. It starts with fresh notes of bergamot, lemon, pepper, and juniper berriesbright and airy. As it settles, gentle hints of incense, pine needles, and orris root add a soft, woody touch. The base notes of amber, vanilla, and sandalwood provide a warm and creamy finish.<br />
<br />
However, I noticed its not long-lasting, which seems common with other perfumes from the brand. If you dont mind reapplying during the day, its an easy-to-wear scent thats both pleasant and inoffensive. Gypsy Water is great if youre new to niche fragrances and want something that feels special yet safe.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2259219"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2259219#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2256796" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
