padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1479013">pocketfullofposies</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-18">06/18/24 19:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I loved the juniper and pine but the fragrance quickly disappeared on me. Such an utter shame because its a beautiful scent, albeit it very fleetingly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2192545"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2192545#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188688" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188688" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Risti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466529"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1466529.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Risti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Courreges/Hyper-Musc-87435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.87435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hyper Musc"title="Hyper Musc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188688ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188688" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1466529">Risti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-14">06/14/24 21:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For the price of this I expect longevity and for the smell to extend out from me. This is such a good scent but I won't be repurchasing purely because it does not perform. I also don't get Pine being such a strong note in this?? It's so very subtle, It's starts out citrus earth and pine wood it then flows into very light slightly sweet vanilla which the sandalwood balances out really well. And then nothing within an hour or 2. I really want to love it, and I feel like anyone else who enjoys this scent is also let down with the life of it. I have found a couple of NZ oil perfumerys that do imitations but so far no one has the scent down yet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2188688"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2188688#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2187218" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2187218" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="REINITO"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843316"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1843316.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="REINITO" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Boy-Eau-de-Parfum-37473.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37473.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boy Eau de Parfum"title="Boy Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2187218ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2187218" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843316">REINITO</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-13">06/13/24 12:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This doesn't last long enough on my skin to even rate it or jot down my thoughts. A spray of sweet woody nothing that fades almost immediately.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2187218"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2187218#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2185877" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2185877" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nataliemarie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.273464.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nataliemarie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Thomas-Kosmala/Apres-l-Amour-53742.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53742.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aprs lAmour"title="Aprs lAmour"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2185877ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2185877" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/273464">Nataliemarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-12">06/12/24 07:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a few from Oil of Perfumery, (Not sponsored), but, I'll just tell you if you do not feel like reading, go get that if you are just "Curious". I was &amp; ordered this Oil from them, my initial reaction was "WHEWWWW", so glad I didn't blind buy. Then I realized in my millions of tiny samples I had one of GW! Well,  the oil nails it &amp; It's less than $20. However if you love pine needles &amp; want to spray your clothes &amp; hair, by all means buy it. I rolled my OIL on my wrist before bed last night &amp; Alllll I could smell was PINE, Mistake before bed. I did it again, this morning &amp; I'm ok with it &amp; it's not suffocating me. Calming down quicker. I don't agree with the review below on the Vanilla overload, I don't get much Vanilla (in either). I actually wish there was more. I DO agree with it needing the addition of a little Woody molecule (Hello Javanol), which I have, so that will be how I use this. Prob a Vanilla lotion, my oil, or sample spray topped with an extra boost  of Javanol. I would not be able to tell them apart unless I was able to pick out that GW may be a tiny bit less screechy that the oil. It could be that the Oil is louder, which some may want, since people are saying they cant smell GW,.. You can smell this Oil. If I was given a bottle of GW, I'd wear it, &amp; play with layering. I wouldn't pay that price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2185877"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2185877#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182805" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182805" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Olenchyk"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2043694"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2043694.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Olenchyk" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Sospiro-Perfumes/Prima-Donna-75939.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75939.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Prima Donna"title="Prima Donna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182805ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182805" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2043694">Olenchyk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-09">06/09/24 05:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I would have loved this fragrance (and quite a few more from Byredo, too) IF its strengths would have been amped up by a factor of 3 at least. <br />
It has a lovely refreshing citrusy-juniper opening, a smooth buttery orris root hug on the skin and a warm sandalwood base in an hour or so after wearing<br />
But it is - as most Byredos - just.so.weak. <br />
Funny to read the flabbergasted reviews below, I had the same impression when I got my first Byredo samples <br />
I agree that performance is outrageous for the price point</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2182805"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2182805#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182380" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182380" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ethelcainwearingorpheon"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2160244.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ethelcainwearingorpheon" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182380ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182380" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160244">ethelcainwearingorpheon</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 16:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I want to give a bad review but I will not base it on anything about this fragrance's poor performance as this sadly just comes down to the ingredients used and we can't get down to the molecular level and change "fresh" and "citrussy" ingredients volatility. But we can admit (and shame) the disgusting overdumping of vanilla ( and its trashy cheap version). The idea behind this fragrance does not match the name at all but this is a common byredo disease (like naming a fragrance inflorescence but not making it smell like figs girl?). BUT OK let us continue on why vanilla ruins this beautiful fragrance that yes reminds me of water. Water in a clean coniferous forest. This is the water they infused in the gin cocktails at orpheon... so why on earth would you add vanilla? Its a cloying vanilla and I cannot stress enough how disgusting and nauseating I find it. And you will think "cloying?" in a byredo fragrance? is this guy smelling gypsy water? Yes I am and yes I will die on this hill that that skanky cheap dollar store vanillin they're using to make this fragrance is the sole reason it flopped for me. If you like green fragrances go for it, but be warned you may smell like the pasty and chemical vanilla pods they sell at the grocery store. Not vanilla in a creme brulee typa way. No vanilla in an off-brand cheap tub of vanilla ice cream. This could have an even bigger cult following if it superdosed some more woody molecules and was stripped clean of its awful vanillic facets. Outrageous.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2182380"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2182380#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2162354" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2162354" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BestBohemianLife"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2135455"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BestBohemianLife" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2162354ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2162354" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2135455">BestBohemianLife</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 14:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a freebie of this, so no loss that I didn't love it. It opens very woody and desert-y, nice at first, almost like a room scent for a spa at Joshua Tree. But it dries down to a powdery scent much too quickly and gets very feminine, IMO. Not thrilled with the finish. Longevity is decent, but I would have preferred much more of the early notes. I might use it as a linen spray.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2162354"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2162354#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2158539" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2158539" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Crc199000"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2133646"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2133646.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Crc199000" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Philosophy/Pure-Grace-4854.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4854.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pure Grace"title="Pure Grace"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2158539ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2158539" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2133646">Crc199000</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-16">05/16/24 20:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wanted to love this one but unfortunately, as soon as I smelled my sample, I got a big hit of musty, out-of-date spice cabinet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2158539"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2158539#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2157292" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2157292" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cypress2"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1777766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cypress2" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2157292ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2157292" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1777766">Cypress2</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-15">05/15/24 17:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If I had been writing this review a year ago, I would have said I couldnt smell anything. Strangely, by the time I finished my sample, I  could appreciate a lovely sandalwood vanilla and I HAD to get a bottle because Gypsy Water was still evolving each time I wore it. Now I can smell it faintly all day and I smell a sweeter note, maybe the lemon meringue pie.  I am not sure this is the maceration others have mentioned or that my nose learned the scent. <br />
<br />
I think this is an excellent fragrance, very soothing and appropriate for all occasions. I do wish it were a bit stronger though the more I wear Gypsy Water the more I think that the understated aspect is part of the charm. <br />
<br />
I may check out the dupe recommendations. I would like a bedtime body cream in this scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2157292"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2157292#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2156349" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2156349" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gilsan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/629292"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.629292.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gilsan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Mandarine-Basilic-2060.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2060.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Mandarine Basilic"title="Aqua Allegoria Mandarine Basilic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2156349ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2156349" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2036597">Moonstrukk</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-11">05/11/24 11:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is just amazing  I loved it the very first time I tried it. It's so expensive. Too expensive..but if you have byredo money...get her. Keep her close and wear her. She's bright and fresh and sweet and deep but in a really elegant soft way. It's another one of those fragrances that just make me feel a certain way. I feel like the juniper gets me..it keeps the scent alive is such a spectacular way for me. It's good on clothes for longevity, I tend to just spray a little on skin and the rest on clothes. I'm an over sprayer so I get a good 8-10 hours. Definitely better in warmer weather. She did not disappoint! The PRICE tho...I'm exploring some excellent dupes... they are holding up</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2152792"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2152792#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2151816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2144362" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Frangipanilove"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.528960.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Frangipanilove" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Aqua-Vitae-Forte-31404.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31404.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Vitae Forte"title="Aqua Vitae Forte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2144362ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2144362" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/528960">Frangipanilove</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-03">05/03/24 08:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Spritzy aromatic gin (juniper berry) and citrus opening that goes away very quickly leaving behind a soft and naturalistic vanilla with a hint of natural sandalwood (Gypsy Water manages to avoid the harshness that arises from the overuse of many of the synthetic sandalwood replacers, hurrah!). Very pleasant, if a bit faint skin scent within minutes. Pleasant, even pretty and easy to be in but not sure if this would merit the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2144362"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2144362#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2142711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1351289">nguyenxxx</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-01">05/01/24 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This just smells sweet from beginning to end. A tolerable sweetness but not something I would seek out. Vanilla and something else a little synthetic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2142711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2142711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137552" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2137552" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jow012"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1722924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jow012" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2137552ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2137552" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1722924">jow012</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 19:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Soft and definitely gender neutral. If you want to smell clean, gentle, hydrated, put together, while also hinting at a mysterious side - this is so nice. I'm not getting the grandpa dry-down others are talking about. While it's more complex than more affordable scents - It definitely does not last and you will have to re-apply at around the 2-3 hour mark. However, I feel that these type of scents are best this way because you wouldn't get this same softness if it WAS something that lasted long. See how it performs on your own skin and decide for yourself.<br />
<br />
Byredo is really fantastic at putting together scents that seem effortless and cling to the skin. If you don't like sweet scents but want something soft with character you should definitely try this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2137552"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2137552#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2135689" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Last about 30 minutes. Do what you will with this information</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2135689"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2135689#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2135428" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2135428" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MissFunmiiii"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473639"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1473639.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MissFunmiiii" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2135428ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2135428" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1473639">MissFunmiiii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-24">04/24/24 18:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I started working after college in 2015. And I remember going to the bars with one of our managers! And he literally smelled intoxicating! He was not even close my type but he smelled sooooo good! I complimented him the whole time. I never forgot that smell. He told us it was curve for men but now I know he lied! This is my first time smelling Gypsy water and THIS IS WHAT HE WAS WEARING! I think it smells good on both genders! But it smells incredible on men! Its so amazing the impact a fragrance has. 9 years later</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2135428"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2135428#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131649" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2131649" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ginda"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2099912"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2099912.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ginda" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2131649ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2131649" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2099912">Ginda</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-21">04/21/24 11:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was a love at first sniff for me - the opening was perfection imo. Spicy and fresh, it was the lemon and black pepper that came through. <br />
<br />
Weird thing was that this actually lasted for ages on me, 6+ hours. BUT I was so frustrated that the lingering scent was juniper and frankincense, which I enjoyed a lot less than the opening to the point where I wasn't really keen. I didn't get vanilla at all. <br />
<br />
I will give the sample one more go because the start was definitely full bottle worthy for me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2131649"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2131649#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2131525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2117442" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Betsyw1109"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1808555"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Betsyw1109" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2117442ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2117442" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1808555">Betsyw1109</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-07">04/07/24 14:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gypsy water starts out very fresh and aromatic. I really smelled the juniper and was excited to experience the dry down. Unfortunately, as the day wore on, it began taking on a very unlikeable qualityalmost like body odor. I put it on my neck and some got on my hair and I keep getting whiffs of it and its making me sick. I am so sad because I was looking forward to the sandalwood/amber base notes but it just turned bad on my body chemistry. Too bad</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2117442"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2117442#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2110170" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; To be fair, I think this is literally the scent a lot of the stores and hotels used and I didnt know it then, but smelling it today really took me back to my days in ATX. If you love Austin you will love this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2110170"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2110170#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2109489" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105960" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andjsa"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945410"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andjsa" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105960ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105960" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1945410">Andjsa</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 11:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Doesn't really smell "fresh" or "watery" to me like everyone's describing. It's not at all what I was expecting from the name, or from reading reviews and watching videos of people describing the scent. I feel it's quite similar to Atelier Cologne Vanille Insense, which I think is unfortunately discontinued, or Commodity Gold, which is much better value and lasts way longer in my experience. All are woody, dry vanilla scents. Like if vanilla-scented woodchips existed. It's vanilla without the sweetness, and I actually quite like it, but it's been done (and done better) many times before.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2105960"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2105960#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2104861" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102227" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="desertdweller"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2069581"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2069581.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="desertdweller" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Oriza-L-Legrand/Reve-d-Ossian-16252.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.16252.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Reve d'Ossian"title="Reve d'Ossian"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102227ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102227" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2069581">desertdweller</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-23">03/23/24 20:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo nailed the essence of water in this fragrance but the gypsy seems to have wandered away. There is the slightest whiff of lemon but it too dissipates quickly. This might be the most underwhelming fragrance I've ever sampled and thank God it was only that.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2102227"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2102227#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2101672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Just finished a bottle of GW that Ive had for a year and started a new one, the new one smells so much weaker. Spritzed it ten times and will be storing it somewhere dark for the next two months, just in time for summer!<br />
<br />
Really wish Byredo would release an option for a stronger scent formulation, an Extrait de parfum of GW would have me yeeting money out of my wallet. But for real, please Byredo, make your gorgeous scents stronger!!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2098600"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2098600#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2098553" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This isnt a perfume I would think a gypsy would wear. I can't believe people were hyping this up so much, and that it costs the price that it does, especially since this perfume gives me the same vibe as CK In2U For Women.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2090434"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2090434#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088717" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088717" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chloerose666"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1950146"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1950146.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chloerose666" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Remember-Me-49435.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49435.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Remember Me"title="Remember Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088717ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088717" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1950146">Chloerose666</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 00:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells absolutely gorgeous, shame it lasts for about 5 minutes. I don't get how something this weak can be priced so high tbh. <br />
<br />
Loved the fragrance, smells like a gently spiced lemon and bergamot pine tea. if it lasted 6-8 hours (I don't tend to struggle with longevity in many fragrances, usually have fairly good results and I tried to layer this and also use unscented moisturiser but it didn't really help) it would be FB worthy but alas I will not waste my money.<br />
<br />
Ive ordered a dupe from te essence vault of G Water Intense so im hoping its at least similar with better longevity! will update here once received (there are many many other dupes and similar frags available)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2088717"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2088717#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2081268" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2081268" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChemicalCracker"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2041819"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2041819.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChemicalCracker" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-71608.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71608.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold"title="Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2081268ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2081268" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2041819">ChemicalCracker</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-03">03/03/24 16:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lovely unique scent but boy oh boy it has zero lasting power and low to moderate projection. It's slightly sweet and fun, a casual scent, but the pricetag does not mirror the product unfortunately.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2081268"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2081268#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078732" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078732" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jckl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039263"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2039263.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jckl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078732ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078732" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039263">jckl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 04:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Versatile and gives fresh, spicy, woody vibes. Aptly named.<br />
<br />
However nothing can justify the horrendous projection and life span of this on skin &amp; clothes, both abysmal. Disappears into a light skin scent within 15 minutes? on pulse points, then completely within 2-3 hours, and does not even last on clothes/scarves. Expect that this would be undetectable by anyone encountered through the day - I even forgot I applied when I gave this another go recently.<br />
<br />
Definitely would not recommend, price tag is extortionate for scented water.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2078732"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2078732#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078202" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2078202" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Petrichor134"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454084"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Petrichor134" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2078202ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2078202" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454084">Petrichor134</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-29">02/29/24 14:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wicked Good has incredibly long lasting and great version of this. I got a sample from their site and it is very close and might dare say even better. Some notes are more pronounced, it lasts for hours and has great sillage. I would love to think of it as forest, dancing under the trees and lemon cakes, but it reminds me of something Andrew Ryan would wear in the Bioshock. I get this mysterious 30' vibe (even though Rapture was around 50') but I imagine he was young in the roaring 20'-30'. It has that rich, mysterious vintage cologne vibe. Maybe because of the pine. It's still softened by lemon and vanilla making it more of a unisex perfume. I fell in love, but not in the original.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2078202"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2078202#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2076668" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; And indeed it did, gone after 30 minutes. Lovely lovely scent, lemon to open, a sultry incense in the middle and vanilla on the (30 second long) dry down but in my opinion not worth the price at all. It just doesnt last or project at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2075921"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2075921#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2075747" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2075747" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="IronOrchid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2031932"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="IronOrchid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3575.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gypsy Water"title="Gypsy Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2075747ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2075747" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2031932">IronOrchid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-27">02/27/24 09:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't like sweet fragrances (disclaimer) and this, to me, is far too cloying. Smells like marzipan mixed with Germolene. On the plus side, it fades off quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2075747"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2075747#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073602" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073602" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Heliotrope72"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951661"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1951661.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Heliotrope72" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Al-Rehab/Choco-Musk-20139.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20139.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Choco Musk"title="Choco Musk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073602ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073602" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1951661">Heliotrope72</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-25">02/25/24 09:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rating: <br />
Do I like it: Actually yes<br />
Who it is: A kind host of a medieval themed home in the middle of the forest that offers you freshly made food and a safe place to rest <br />
Smells I get: juniper, pine needles, lemon-vanilla cake on a sandalwood table, amber<br />
Meyer's Briggs type: INFJ, ISFJ<br />
<br />
Makes me feel like I'm in Hagrid's hut from Harry Potter and Hagrid had just made lemon cakes for everyone, or as if Beorn from the Hobbit series just took my party inside to get some food and rest from the cold and damp evergreen forest outside. <br />
I can almost hear the fire crackling just imagining it. <br />
<br />
Smells like a lemon cake on my skin prostrated on a sandalwood table, with bits of warm amber and juniper popping up from time to time. First Byredo's offering that agrees with my skin, not pulling acetonic or overly soapy. However, this is still a very shy smelly liquid - it's a skin scent, albeit a very pleasant one. Suprisingly warm and delightful, a bit gourmand, a bit green, and allmost cuddly and sensual at times. <br />
<br />
Will be happily wearing this one again, since it's probably a good amber-gourmand for summer due to the (lack of) potency and the green and citrus notes, but I don't think I'll get any more than a decant. Very yummy, comforting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2073602"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2073602#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2073513" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2073513" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="koxayous"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303753"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1303753.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="koxayous" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2073513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2073513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1303753">koxayous</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-25">02/25/24 07:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>opens with a creamy lemony vanilla blast, reminiscent of a lemony fizziness in kurkdijans aqua vitae, accompanied by a soft accord of juniper and a powdery dustiness of black pepper. I don't get much of a pine, but lots of creamy vanilla with its characteristic bitter undertone and delicious buttery orris. <br />
although rather simple, it perfectly aligns with the brand vision, and its very, very nice. big compliment getter too<br />
<br />
I have it in edp &amp; oil version, while edp performance is ok, the oil seems to evaporate off my skin in less than 20 minutes. for some reason byredos oil rollers are much weaker than their original edps.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2073513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2073513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2070974" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2070974" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fformoso88"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/638972"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.638972.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fformoso88" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/Madison-Avenue-35956.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.35956.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Madison Avenue"title="Madison Avenue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2070974ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2070974" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); Soft, great for everyday. Unisex, universal, diverse. You can mix this fragrance with other fragrances it smells amazing as a base too. Its just a clean, woody, mysterious, intriguing scent. I love it! Its the best! Great anytime day or night lots of compliments a sexy fragrance!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2070974"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2070974#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2069559" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
