padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1932468">Cherryz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-21">02/21/24 10:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm reading some reviews saying it's fresh and I'm so surprised, because I get dirty hippies (or gypsies) bathing in incense. There's some dry pine needles and wood in it as well, but it's missing that depth unless I put my nose on my wrist and take a whiff. It's a skin scent from the start, no projection at all.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2069559"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2069559#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2068745" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It's very faint, but even the non-moldy parts aren't alluring. Sort of like a cheap $1 scented candle with poor throw next to a vase with old water.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2068745"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2068745#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2067989" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I wish it is little bit stronger (better projection) I did not find real dupe for this one yet</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2066983"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2066983#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2061445" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2061445" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Commander3778"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1685507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1685507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Commander3778" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Givenchy/Gentlemen-Only-Casual-Chic-29733.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29733.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentlemen Only Casual Chic"title="Gentlemen Only Casual Chic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2061445ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2061445" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1685507">Commander3778</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-13">02/13/24 18:00</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I was surprised by the way this smelled but not disappointed. I definitely wasn't impressed at first but it's grown on me, I get lemon, a whiff of something woody, and a LOT of powder. Which I don't mind one bit, I love powdery scents. This is clean and very inoffensive. The lemon here is really nice, it's sweet with a tiny bit of spice that gives it a kick. Might be the pepper. <br />
<br />
The sillage on this is almost nonexistent, the performance is honestly terrible, even for someone like me who prefers skin scents. I like scents that sit close to my skin, but would rather not spray every few hours. I could actually go on to say it might be undetectable on occasion.<br />
<br />
This perfume can be used anytime, any season. Trust me, no one will be able to detect it within two hours and if they do, they'll just catch the lemon. <br />
<br />
All in all this scent is 7/10. It smells good, but for the performance I feel it's overpriced. I would pair it with a lotion and hand cream to extend it but I just don't feel like it's worth all the $$$ I guess that's what happens when you build a strong brand and sell it as "luxurious"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2061445"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2061445#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2060910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2060910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pepperwhy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1995931"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="pepperwhy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2060910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2060910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); You might need two sprays per each place. However, I am in love with this scent. Its spicy then sweet.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2060910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2060910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2059524" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2059524" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Naoelyse"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2011280"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2011280.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Naoelyse" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3575.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gypsy Water"title="Gypsy Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2059524ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2059524" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2011280">Naoelyse</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-11">02/11/24 19:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Light, sugar lemon pine. Very soft and subtle. Mostly I love it, but every third time I try to wear it it smells "dusty" and I can't figure out why.<br />
<br />
Update: Looking for the same kind of magic in a 'different, darker font'? Try Meo Fuciuni's L'Oblio. It has intentional dustiness and the same sheer and mesmerizing quality with less citrus and way better longevity.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2059524"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2059524#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2056874" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2056874" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hrhalexandru6"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1900210.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="hrhalexandru6" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Babycat-73149.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.73149.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Babycat"title="Babycat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2056874ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2056874" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1900210">hrhalexandru6</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-09">02/09/24 02:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Zesty, lemony, fresh. It's a lovely day fragrance. Turns a little sweet after an hour, but it's so gentle that it works with everything. Had to try it multiple times to actually reach the conclusion of "yes I'm getting this" because it didn't have a projection worth the hassle, but eventually this Byredo piece grew on me. Got it and it's a happy buy. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2056874"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2056874#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2055073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2055073" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="cookygirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="cookygirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/L-Occitane-en-Provence/Neroli-Orchidee-24457.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.24457.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Nroli & Orchide"title="Nroli & Orchide"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2055073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2055073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/874574">cookygirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-07">02/07/24 11:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It's... fine?. I get lots of lemon throughout the wear but I also do get most of the other listed notes.<br />
It's basically a lemony- aromatic scent on me with a nice dose of sandal and powder.<br />
What I don't get though is the hype.<br />
Emperor's new clothes as far as I'm concerned. <br />
This is nothing special to me at all.<br />
Something I might consider buying if I had nothing similar in my wardrobe but only if it were a cheapie which we all know it is NOT.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2055073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2055073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2051178" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2051178" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="robertambark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434211"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1434211.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="robertambark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jo-Malone-London/Wood-Sage-Sea-Salt-25529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"title="Wood Sage & Sea Salt"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2051178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2051178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434211">robertambark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-03">02/03/24 13:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've gotten my hands on this perfume as I was starting my corporate career.<br />
Gypsy Water is seen as a very clean-girl and office-appropriate fragrance, which is inoffensive and easy to wear. This is my go-to for a striped shirt and blue jeans outfits. Never realised for vanillary this smells on me despite all of the other notes. I've also come to realise this is slightly too sweet for me. Simple and versatile fragrance, but Byredo have some better options in my opinion.<br />
<br />
Edit: the scent disappears after about 45min, so for the price point there's other musky and clean perfumes with better performance in the market.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2051178"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2051178#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2049566" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2049566" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="yumari"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1988744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="yumari" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2049566ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2049566" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); It's a soft cozy but bright skin scent. I enjoy it for days I feel more innocent/youthful, imagine simple white dress out on a sunny day. To many people this apparently smells like grandma but this smells a bit more sophisticated. I don't think I'll ever run out of my bottle of this one given how little I use it but still something I enjoy every now and then.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2047597" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GreatNorth"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1954799"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="GreatNorth" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2047597ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2047597" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); The top notes disappear quickly and you end up with a creamy-soapy- powdery orris-amber-sandalwood that is vaguely herbal.<br />
<br />
It smells nice but its not what I was looking for. <br />
<br />
Can be worn any time, all year. The orris root makes it very creamy and quite sexy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2047597"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2047597#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2046122" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I definitely get the juniper, citrus, and pine. It reminds me of essential oils burning in a diffuser. It just doesnt resonate with me or my personal tastes - dont see myself reaching for this often.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2043852"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2043852#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2040231" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2034243" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nucka"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1959422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1959422.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nucka" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2034243ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2034243" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73); padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030618" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="battersbyfiona"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1715910"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1715910.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="battersbyfiona" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030618ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030618" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1715910">battersbyfiona</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-14">01/14/24 08:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A lemony vanilla scent. Sort or reminds me of Live and Crime but with less anise and more vanilla. It's got a bit of a powdery note as well. A little marshmallowy and woody. It's a nice scent but the projection and longevity are weak. Nor worth the price tag in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2030618"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2030618#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2026303" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2026303" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StrangeQuark"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1784265"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1784265.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="StrangeQuark" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Gold-71608.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71608.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gold"title="Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2026303ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2026303" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1784265">StrangeQuark</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-10">01/10/24 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For me this is mostly citrus fragrance and I'm not a fan of citruses. But I really like this one! The pepper and woody notes make it very aromatic. Vanilla nicely blends with all of the other notes, without making this fragrance a sweet one. Unfortunately the longevity and performance is not the best. I have a 12 ml travel size but I don't know if I'll get a full bottle, considering how expensive it is.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2026303"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2026303#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2023338" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2023338" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stefani valini"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250908"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1250908.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stefani valini" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Room-1015/Cherry-Punk-61264.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61264.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cherry Punk"title="Cherry Punk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2023338ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2023338" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1250908">stefani valini</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-07">01/07/24 06:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is such a beautiful scent,  it's perfect for everyday (siganture scent). It opens very citrusy, but its fade away to make place to vanilla and juniper. I perceive a creamy sandalwood as well. I do not perceive encens . The performance i bad, it dosn't project and last maybe 4h on me. I love Byredo's perfumes</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2023338"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2023338#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2022655" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2022655" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bondno9girl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488513"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1488513.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bondno9girl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2022655ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2022655" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1488513">Bondno9girl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-06">01/06/24 13:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I did about 15 sprays on clothing because I dont tend to spray on skin. I sprayed about 4 house ago and can still smell it wafting around me when I move. This is going strong for sure but performs more like an edt, very delicate. I'm going to guess that this will lasts 6 to 8 hours on my sweater but I will update after I have worn it that long. My boyfriend did complement me after 2 hours of wear and said it smelled super good. He thinks it's smells like citrus candy. I have to agree. I'm not even a citrus person like at all but this is beautiful because of the woodiness which I am a sucker for. I expected horrible performance because of all the reviews but now I am starting to think people are spraying less than 10 sprays and not on clothing. You must do at least 15 and on your clothing if you want to smell this one. You can't only spray 5 times and expect to smell this all day, there is no way. Citrus fragrances have poor performance so just know that going into this. Some require more sprays than others and if you can't get behind that then I wouldn't purchase. It looks like I didn't even spray my bottle so I dont think overspraying is a big deal. Going to take me forever to use up my 3.4 ounce bottle. I did get it for a killer deal for around $160.00 on fragrancebuy on a boxing sale deal. I noticed it is $195.00 right now which is still better than retail. And yes its an authentic bottle, performance is great.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2022655"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2022655#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2020949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1434256">tolkii</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 02:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opened up very juniper and peppery, don't know about the orris root but the soft pine and incense are a sophisticated, smart but crafty "cabinesque" combination. Very unisex, I would've said masculine leaning so the large amount of feminine votes surprised me, however I can see it as the vanilla basenote gives the perfume that mellow sensual feel . Its biggest downfall is the weak longevity; lingers a tad bit longer on clothes but on the skin the best of the scent was over in around 2 hours - I'd rather spray a whole lot of fakes of this rather than pay for the real product.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2020949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2020949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2018409" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2018409" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CrissyCK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388879.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CrissyCK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/Another-13-10131.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10131.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Another 13"title="Another 13"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2018409ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2018409" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388879">CrissyCK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-02">01/02/24 20:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This scent is light and woody, and a bit linear. My Bond No 9 Governor's Island is very similar but much better with more depth (lasts much longer as well).  They are both priced on the higher side, so I prefer Bond over this.  I've been using this as an everyday spray during fall/winter when I don't want to waste my favorites. Still good, just not nearly as good as similar perfumes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2018409"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2018409#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2014283" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2014283" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BllyDncr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1909034"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1909034.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="BllyDncr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2014283ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2014283" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1909034">BllyDncr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-29">12/29/23 12:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My favorite scent of all time. Light, crisp but warm. Wearing it feels like a hug. I dont get the notes individually besides the lemon pepper at the top; its so beautifully blended its indescribable to me except that its just soft and gorgeous, uplifting and clean while warm and sensual at the same time. Lasting power isnt great, its just the truth (I only buy from Byredo directly as Ive seen that mentioned) and its an expensive one to overspray or touch up but its worth it. It lasts a long time on clothes and my husband can still smell it on me when Ive gone a little nose blind hours into my day, but its still more of a soft skin scent. Which I love, as beasts give me migraines. There honestly arent a lot of perfumes in this world that I like and less that I love and this is my greatest love. It is a beautifully composed fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2014283"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2014283#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2013448" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2013448" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kaleigha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1233422.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kaleigha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Commodity/Rain-29545.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.29545.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rain"title="Rain"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2013448ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2013448" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1233422">Kaleigha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-28">12/28/23 14:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my very first Byredo experience, and sadly it just didn't work out for me. Don't get me wrong, the scent was gorgeous - it was everything I was hoping for. And then what felt like only minutes later, it was gone. Pouf! So I tried a respray a couple of hours later, and it was indetectable in less than half an hour. It was really disappointing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2013448"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2013448#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2011707" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2011707" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="huntielle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325774"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1325774.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="huntielle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2011707ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2011707" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1325774">huntielle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-26">12/26/23 21:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love it so much, but sadly, it doesnt last on me (and yes, I purchased from official Byredo website). I have Commodity Gold which smells very similar to me, and it lasts about the same amount of time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2011707"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2011707#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2008949" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MissStarE1973"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427924"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1427924.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MissStarE1973" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Stella-McCartney/Sheer-Stella-2006-604.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.604.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sheer Stella 2006"title="Sheer Stella 2006"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2008949ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2008949" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1427924">MissStarE1973</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-23">12/23/23 12:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought both the Nomade &amp; Bois discovery sets, and I've been trying them, one by one: I'm testing GW today (3 sprays on each forearm), and I love it. It reminds me so much of Tocca's Colette, and I love her, too. I can't stop smelling my wrists! <br />
This is a cozy scent, intimate, and unassuming; the sillage is not there, but I appreciate skin scents, too. I'd classify it as an everyday scent: safe for the workplace. The projection is minimal, too, but, again, it's the type of scent that's appreciated up close &amp; personal. Byredo scents last a long time in my skin, but I have oily skin, and I moisturize, which helps scents last.  <br />
Byredo prices are a bit much, but can be found other places for way cheaper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2008949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2008949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2006730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2006730" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jscents39"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1744457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1744457.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jscents39" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2006730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2006730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1744457">Jscents39</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-20">12/20/23 23:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like this. Such a comforting, casual cool scent. Its fresh with the citrus and pine, and then there is a creamy vanilla wood in the dry down. It keeps the freshness throughout. This is definitely similar to Tocca Collette, but that one has less of the fresh forest aspect, and is more powdery/slightly more sweet. Definitely want this but will likely get the hair perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2006730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2006730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2002868" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2002868" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Caprisumn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1843675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Caprisumn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2002868ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2002868" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1843675">Caprisumn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-16">12/16/23 11:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>a very fresh, clean, citrus scent. Unisex. Like your outside in fresh air near a fragrant lemon tree.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="2002868"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=2002868#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1999828" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1999828" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Inenell"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/187409"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.187409.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Inenell" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/APOM-Pour-Homme-6806.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6806.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="APOM Pour Homme"title="APOM Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1999828ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1999828" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/187409">Inenell</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-12">12/12/23 20:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo is one of the most faked houses around, especially the more popular choices from the house.  So if we're being honest with ourselves, a good bit of these reviews are from unsuspecting Amazon or Ebay buyers, who couldnt pass up that too good to be true price tag.  Comments about the fragrance being short-lived or the large amount of votes for female in the gender section are so confusing to me.  Opens with sharp lemon and pine with an almost cypress-woodsy masculine feel.  That immediately transitions into a cozy, creamy mid where the lemon and vanilla combine to give a delicious creamsicle-like presence that lasts for several hours on my skin.  That mid is wonderful and has always been the lasting impression I get from Gypsy Water.  Like a lemon meringue pie surrounded by woods and trees.  The far dry down is where I feel the incense, but I would never say this is a smoky dominant fragrance.  Versatile, classy, masculine, and absolutely the best Byredo has to offer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1999828"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1999828#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1999691" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; This gorgeous scent will forever have a choke hold on me, but dear godpleeeeease make it last for more than an hour as a skin scent! </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1998269" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fragriminator"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632910"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1632910.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fragriminator" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nishane/Hacivat-44174.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44174.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hacivat"title="Hacivat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1998269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1998269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1632910">Fragriminator</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 04:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've had a 5ml decant of this for some time and I've worn it occasionally. For me, the fragrance is among the more unique out there. I like it, but more as something to smell around, not to wear. The profile is a dead ringer for shaving cream on an orange scented graham cracker. Peace 2u.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1998269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1998269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1995681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1995681" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Petrichor134"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454084"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Petrichor134" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1995681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1995681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1454084">Petrichor134</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-08">12/08/23 03:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Weird aftershave beginning followed by a little bit of aromatic lemon scent that is more impersonation rather than fresh citrus, one similar note that Baccarat Rouge has, and Felce Azzurra talk powder. But the hype got me so hyped I managed to get a sample and then crave it because it's hyped. Sometimes I'm so easily influenced it's borderline psychotic. I should get myself checked. No projection, no staying power, at all. I can absolutely see myself owning a bottle, which I surely didn't buy myself, and then spend my whole life wishing for decent longevity.<br />
Edit: I think I've caught a whiff of JHAG  Vanilla vibes. It changes so quickly and lasts so short I couldn't possibly be sure.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1995681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1995681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994820" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1994820" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PDB1978"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1893961"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="PDB1978" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Fucking-Fabulous-46513.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46513.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fucking Fabulous"title="Fucking Fabulous"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1994820ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1994820" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1893961">PDB1978</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-07">12/07/23 03:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If anyone is interested and has the budget for it - super cedar layered with gypsy water is really nice and it does keep it going for longer - I liked the very short lived pine opening and SC brings it more forward for longer. <br />
<br />
But like someone else said they can make it stronger but just dont - which just reinforces capitalism.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1994820"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1994820#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994617" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; It is sweet and smoky at the same time. Smells like cloves to me, but bad sillage. 4/5</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1994617"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1994617#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1993559" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993559" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Symphonized"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1897892"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1897892.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Symphonized" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993559ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993559" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1897892">Symphonized</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-05">12/05/23 20:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sampled this and absolutely loved it. To my novice nose, I didn't make out a lot of the middle green notes, but to me, the dry down was the most gorgeous part. The creamy sandalwood was incredible when the scent fully meshed with my skin. Disappointingly, everyone is correct - this is such a light fragrance. It does not project when worn outside and it is really subtle even indoors. I did smell this on me for ~6 hours, but it was a very nice intimate sillage. It's definitely something I want to add to my collection, but it will need a full 10ml decant trial first.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1993559"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1993559#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1992700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310923">blindboughtjunkie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-04">12/04/23 21:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a very nice scent...that's all I can say. Not my type of scent. It actually somewhat reminds me of Burberry Brit  the same dusty lemony vanilla vibe, maybe just a bit woodier and more interesting. It's only been 3 hours since I've sprayed it and it's barely there. That seems to be the case for most Byredo fragrances, which is sad considering the hefty, hefty price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1992700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1992700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991881" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1991881" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Becktacular"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906459"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1906459.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Becktacular" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1991881ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1991881" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906459">Becktacular</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-04">12/04/23 01:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is frustrating because about 20-30 seconds after spraying it, it smells absolutely wonderful and really unique and intriguing. Then it dries down to a very pleasant peppery, powdery incensey vanilla - that reminds me massively of Anna Sui Dreams from the early 2000s. Very nice, but barely any projection even after over spraying. It lasts a reasonable amount of time so theres that. I like this, it is a lovely fragrance, but not at all justified for the price. I want it to project more and to be that unusual scent 30 seconds after spraying.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1991881"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1991881#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1991047" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
