padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1990576" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="becgoesoink"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751311"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1751311.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="becgoesoink" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Merit/Retrospect-98154.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.98154.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Retrospect"title="Retrospect"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1990576ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1990576" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1751311">becgoesoink</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-02">12/02/23 09:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The only negative I really have to say about this perfume is the name ... I just got bored with it pretty quickly. I like that there's an aromatic quality along with what smelled like a chopped wood with a tiny spill of vanilla. To me, it's a subtle, year-round scent: just ultimately didn't enjoy wearing it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1990576"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1990576#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1986439" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1986439" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sw1707"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1907424"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="sw1707" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1986439ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1986439" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1907424">sw1707</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-27">11/27/23 08:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Save yourself some money and get Blue Santal by Comme des Garcons instead. <br />
<br />
Smells basically the same, performs better and is much cheaper.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1986439"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1986439#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985675" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1985675" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AnivadGC"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564965"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1564965.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AnivadGC" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Van-Cleef-Arpels/Moonlight-Patchouli-38374.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38374.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moonlight Patchouli"title="Moonlight Patchouli"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1985675ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1985675" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1564965">AnivadGC</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-26">11/26/23 08:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought this due to all the hype on it. It smells easygoing, light, woody, and approachable without smelling too common. But the longevity for the price is absolutely disappointing. And somehow, after wearing it for a couple of months, I suddenly realized what the smell reminded me ofcardboard boxes. And ever since thats what I picture everytime I smelled it and I just couldnt wear it anymore, so I gave it to my colleague who appreciates the scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1903950">NicheFragFan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-25">11/25/23 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gypsy Water is a poetic fragrance that evokes a bohemian spirit. The blend of bergamot, lemon, pepper, and juniper berries creates a light, ethereal opening. The base of amber, vanilla, and sandalwood adds warmth and depth, making it a perfect scent for those who favor a light, dreamy fragrance</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1983848" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Babs67"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1548476"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1548476.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Babs67" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1983848ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1983848" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1548476">Babs67</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-23">11/23/23 22:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh, GoshI love Gypsy Water! I normally have trouble with fragrances lasting on my skin, but I was pleasantly surprised at the longevity I got with this one. After applying it over Gypsy Water Body Cream this morning I was pleasantly surprised to notice the fragrance still lingered into the night. The blend of incense, vanilla, amber, and sandalwood works well on my skin. It has a very subtle projection, which I like as I dont like overpowering fragrance that announces ones arrival before entering a room. Gypsy Water is my new favorite indeed!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1983848"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1983848#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1982624" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1981646" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Caramel lady"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359719"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1359719.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Caramel lady" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giardini-Di-Toscana/Bianco-Latte-64757.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64757.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bianco Latte"title="Bianco Latte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1981646ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1981646" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1359719">Caramel lady</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-21">11/21/23 04:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the ultimate skin but better fresh perfume - absolutely beautiful<br />
<br />
..  for about 30 minutes   a damn shame it doesnt last for shit. If you invest in this, youre buying the brand + bottle, because where is the perfume experience?<br />
I dont know how such perfumes manage to come on the market and even sell? <br />
<br />
Youd have to douse yourself in this to smell it, and I have no issue with this as I over-spray all of my perfumes. But this would need to be over sprayed every hour or two, just ridiculous. <br />
Extremely poor longevity and therefore silage.<br />
<br />
Youre better off finding a dupe if you really like this- Ive just bought mine from Oakcha, will report back with my findings .<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
Ok, Im back.<br />
I dont enjoy the Oakcha scent, very lemony and also doesnt last that long. Perhaps its the scent profile </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1981646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1981646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979529" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="eaudeeve"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1760327"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1760327.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="eaudeeve" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1760327">eaudeeve</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-18">11/18/23 09:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Believe the hype. This is a beautifully blended fragrance. A peppery, juniper and citrus opening with a soft angelic vanilla dry down. Like being in a forest full of faries</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1979529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1979529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1978261" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1978261" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tilika"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1451158"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tilika" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Oud-Wood-1826.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1826.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Wood"title="Oud Wood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1978261ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1978261" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1451158">Tilika</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-16">11/16/23 14:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like cinnamon :( didnt like it, gave the bottle to a friend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1978261"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1978261#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977533" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1977533" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scissorslizardspock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1026213.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scissorslizardspock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Bois-des-Iles-Eau-de-Parfum-41787.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.41787.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Bois des Iles Eau de Parfum"title="Bois des Iles Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1977533ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1977533" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1026213">Scissorslizardspock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-15">11/15/23 17:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love the scent of Gypsy Water.  As per my previous review, I really did feel like it had a traditionally masculine vibe upon first testing.  But theres a genius here - its very light and ethereal, evoking sunlit pine forests and the beauty of nature.  That ethereal vibe makes this feel ultra feminine and easy to wear.  I spray this on with any girly vibe shower gel/body lotion combo and its elevated.  My 16 year old son wears it and it matches his traditionally masculine smelling body care.  What a versatile scent.  I love it for that!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1977533"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1977533#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1975201" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1975201" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bois-1920/Itruk-32129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Itruk"title="Itruk"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1975201ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1975201" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-12">11/12/23 18:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#407 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
<br />
This is one of two Byredo samples I ordered from Microperfumes back in February. I've been trying all the samples in random order, and tried Bal d'Afrique back in July expecting something exotic, but getting something barely a skin scent for two hours that ended up smelling like pencil shavings and rubber, a scent that's unsurprising in a cheap woody frag at $20, but you'd feel ripped off if you paid more. Long way of saying my expectations going in here were very low. But happily this is a great smelling scent.<br />
<br />
First off: Nothing "watery" going on here. This is not an aquatic. Bad marketing person! Bad! I really like the opening. Nice green, woody aromatic opening. Very ambery, not overdosed on the vanilla. Very smooth and warmly spicy. You can trust the notes.  All very standard, I know. But I am completely happy to smell like this or smell this on any woman. Definitely unisex, but leans masculine to me. The conifer note is not overdone at all but nice.  It's kind of in the same ballpark as my favorite fragrance from a couple of decades ago, Bogart Pour Homme. It's just that it's 7x the price. Moderate projection for me. I think folks in the carpool and elevator will definitely get a whiff, but they'll like it want to know what it is. Skin scent was pretty good for under four hours, which is twice what I got from the Bal d'Afrique. Though, I was just sitting the whole time. If you're active it will probably fade faster. Still, my minimum standard is, "does it at least make it to lunch" and it did.<br />
<br />
So, this is a nice enough scent, but my recommendation if you like this smell, and anyone should, is that instead of spending $145 for Gypsy Water, spend $22 at Jomashop for Franck Olivier Amber EDP. I haven't reviewed it yet, but you can check it out here on Fragrantica. Very complimentary reviews for the most part that I agree with. I want to be clear, it's not a dupe of this Gypsy Water, but it has comparable notes, plus a nice touch of vetiver and patchouli. <br />
<br />
Amber is sold as a men's frag, but not so much. I think any woman I'd want can can totally pull it off.  It's a little earthier than typical of strictly feminine scents, but I personally like that on a woman. I really like it as much as I like this Byredo, and it's legit EDP strength. $22 for an EDP that's really an EDP is not much of a blind buy risk. Yeah I know. It's Franck Olivier. Surprised the hell out of me too, but it's sitting on my shelf right next to the Dior Homme Intense and MFK Grand Soir and it's earning it's space every time I spray it on. Lots of compliments on it, particularly from young women. It definitely outlasts the Byredo fragrance. The reviewers are right that Amber comes off like Dior Ambre Noir, but they're wrong in it doesn't have grandma's rose note which caused me to give it away.  I don't think there are any other amber scents as good as the Olivier Amber for under $100. It's worth a shot, especially for the guys who seem to think this Byredo frag is left of unisex as I would put the Franck Oliver slightly right of unisex.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1975201"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1975201#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3575" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent424885" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc424885" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="icekat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32292"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.32292.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="icekat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lolita-Lempicka/Fleur-Defendue-3004.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3004.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fleur Defendue"title="Fleur Defendue"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma424885ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd424885" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/32292">icekat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-11-09">11/09/13 17:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love casual and down-to-earth scents which convey feeling of being outdoors, but many of them are so harsh and chemical.  Gypsy Water is such a beautiful exception in this category.  The scent is a natural, soft and creamy combination of woods and vanilla spiked with ever-green needles and juniper berries.    It has a perfect balance of being casual but not boring, linear but not simple. Gypsy Water is my jeans and sweater companion to cuddle with on cold November nights.   Lovely, easy to wear and natural, I could never go wrong wearing this scent.      <br />
 <br />
The lemon and bergamot opening makes me think of a windy day outdoors  refreshing and natural.    Yet, right away, the warm rays of sandalwood and vanilla shine through the scent making it soft and comforting.   The iris adds just a touch of powder and pine-tree and juniper berries keep the composition winter fresh.    The scent has a bit of a linear quality but it does not bother me at all, as the composition is absolutely lovely.   It is a soft scent, which makes it a great every day casual scent.  And though it is quite light, it does lasts for hours.  <br />
<br />
Gypsy Water is not the scent that will shock you with its super complex composition or fireworks of notes.   But it is a scent that I will take with me on a winter skiing trip, a walk in the park or everyday at work.     It was such a pleasure to wear that I finished my sample in no time and now craving for the full bottle.  Overall score is 8.5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="424885"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=424885#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent335242" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc335242" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Hatleberger"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/355370"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.355370.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Hatleberger" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Oolang-Infini-9424.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9424.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oolang Infini"title="Oolang Infini"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma335242ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd335242" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/355370">Hatleberger</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-02-13">02/13/13 07:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love the smell of this fragrance. This is my second favourite Byredo, after bal d afrique. However absolutely agree about the lasting power of 10 min at most. May be the most sensitive noses can wear this fragrance... Even though I do prefer very soft fragrances that stay close to the skin, this one leaves some doubts, especially considering the price tag. <br />
Do try it before you invest.<br />
<br />
Update:<br />
I felt obliged to update my comment. As i was not fair in it. Yes, this fragrance has actually swept me away, replacing my signature scent of many years (caleche eau delicate). I was comparing it to serge lutens , amouage, montale perfumes when I said the scent does not last. The lasting power is actually quite long on me, not as bright as at first, but keeps well 12h. The scent does not change much over time, what makes it enjoyable from the start from as long as it lasts.<br />
Now, bal d afrique is the one that fades away quickly and does not rerun even as a hint. I bought both of the perfumes, love them both. But gypsy water is always winning over bal d afrique each time I reach for a perfume bottle. <br />
<br />
Endlessly beautiful!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="335242"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=335242#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent685907" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc685907" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lanuitblanche"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/464527"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.464527.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lanuitblanche" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Papillon-Artisan-Perfumes/Dryad-45963.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45963.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dryad"title="Dryad"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma685907ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd685907" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/464527">lanuitblanche</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-03-11">03/11/16 11:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>When I was a kid in the 80's, I had a Strawberry Shortcake Blow Kiss Baby Doll -- if you pushed the doll's tummy, it would blow you a scented kiss. My doll was Lemon Meringue, and her scented kiss smelled exactly like Byredo's Gypsy Water. I love it. I know it's a weird, random association, but I love this perfume, not only for the unexpected nostalgic flashback, but because the fragrance itself is so beautiful. The Strawberry Shortcake factory must have had an amazing perfumer to work with on their dolls! :-P</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="685907"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=685907#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent119409" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc119409" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ichigogirl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/38431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.38431.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ichigogirl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Atelier-Cologne/Vanille-Insensee-11456.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11456.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Insense"title="Vanille Insense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma119409ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd119409" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/38431">ichigogirl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-01-05">01/05/11 01:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is my very favourite perfume at the moment. I've wanted to buy it for a year but still haven't. I think the reason may be that if I ever feel a bit down, I just go to the perfume shop and try it on, sniff it, and instantly feel better. <br />
Another reason is that it's quite expensive, and I'm afraid it doesn't last long enough on the skin to justify the price tag.<br />
But I love, love, love the soft mix of powder, incense and vanilla. Big love.<br />
Gypsy Water is an unusual perfume, nothing like those from the big designer brands. Speaking of which, I think that the reason Byredo is my favourite perfume-brand at the moment is just that, their perfumes are quite different and often surprising. Not always nice on my skin, but never boring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="119409"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=119409#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1216654" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1216654" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maitton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964648"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.964648.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maitton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Issey-Miyake/L-Eau-d-Issey-pour-Homme-Solar-Lavender-90129.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90129.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Eau d'Issey pour Homme Solar Lavender"title="L'Eau d'Issey pour Homme Solar Lavender"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1216654ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1216654" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/964648">maitton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-27">08/27/20 04:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Gypsy water reminds me of a church and the smell you get when you have a nice lady with citrusy perfume next to you and it mixes with the strong incense and woody notes from old benches. There is a path of lemon through this perfume that feels very naturalif you are into exploration of compositions lightly touched with lemon zest. I think this one is bottle worthy if you collect incense fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1216654"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1216654#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3575" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent870276" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc870276" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bourcet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1090870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="bourcet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Rehab-50351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rehab"title="Rehab"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma870276ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck9x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd870276" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1090870">bourcet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-12">10/12/17 23:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So basically if a perfume was distilled down to Instagram "shelfies" featuring La Mer jars and empty Diptyque candles acting as brush holders, this would be it. One dimensional, fake, and all about a name. Like, the point to owning Byredo Gypsy Water is to take a photo of said Gypsy Water amongst your other Cool Girl Cosmetics and post it on your social media so that other Cool Girls understand that you are One of Them. This perfume eats balls. Honestly it smells like torn leather seats in the back of a taxi cab, and not a NYC yellow cab, a Gypsy cab you hail from the Jamaica LIRR station after the Airtrain from JFK ejects you out into the urban landscape at an ungodly hour. It smells like an Indian eyebrow threading salon, from the hand sanitizer to the scent of whatever lunch the threader ate on their break, to the powder in the waxing rooms. No, no, no.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="870276"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=870276#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent869650" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc869650" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mrsloulou"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10588"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.10588.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="mrsloulou" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Louis-Marie/No-12-Bousval-71216.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71216.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="No.12 Bousval"title="No.12 Bousval"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma869650ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd869650" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/10588">mrsloulou</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-11">10/11/17 04:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For the life of me I don't understand what all the hype is about over this fragrance.  It's lightly scented water with hardly any projection.  I could barely smell any of the notes and believe me my nose knows and I tried but nothing.  This is a ridiculously priced perfume for people who don't like perfume.  I own Colette by Tocca which many are comparing this to and  Colette is so much better than this over-rated stuck up nothing of a fragrance.  I'm a fan of many niche brands and will spend my money when I feel it's warranted but the Byredo brand is lost on me.  Bal d'Afrique is the only scent from this line that has anything to offer and yet it gets a very bored "meh" from me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="869650"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=869650#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent863925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc863925" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Violinplayah"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058697"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1058697.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Violinplayah" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Comete-90434.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90434.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comte"title="Comte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma863925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd863925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1058697">Violinplayah</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-09-23">09/23/17 10:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well, "water" is definitely the operative word here. Not sure if I have a bad sample or if this perfume is way overhyped to justify the price, but this barely has any smell at all. Sticking my nose on my arm and heating it up with my breath I get a slight, nondescript sweetness. No projection period- I don't know how anyone could be complimented because it's basically the smell of lightly scented water. My body wash has better performance. Perhaps this is a perfume for people who don't like perfume, but if that's the case, save your money and don't wear any.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="863925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=863925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent811075" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc811075" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ggillespie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1044730"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ggillespie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chance-Eau-Fraiche-1483.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1483.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chance Eau Fraiche"title="Chance Eau Fraiche"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma811075ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd811075" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1044730">Ggillespie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-09">04/09/17 20:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>After owning this for almost a year, I can finally say this is a no-go for me. I was so intrigued by the description, the name, and the notes. I originally ordered several handy samples from the Byredo website, and it seemed to be great. Then I got greedy and ordered the large pricey bottle, that's when things turned sour. The initial spray is amazing, fresh pine and lemon and I also detect a hint of vanilla. The problem with me is the drydown. Musk, musk, a bit of lemon, and more musk. This may sound gross, but the musk reminds me of my teenage son's room on a Saturday morning, after a week of football or basketball practice, school, and sweat, yet before the Saturday ritual of washing sheets and tidying up. I explained this smell to a cousin of mine, who also has a teenage son, and she said the smell is actually testosterone, according to their endocrinologist. Yuck. Anyway, whatever the smell is, Byredo has captured it. Musk, sweat, testosterone, all I know is this makes me smell like a sweaty man that hasn't had a recent shower and healthy dose of anti-perspirant. Maybe it's my chemistry. I do have a harder time pulling off a lot of fragrances. I handed it off to my son, since he already organically rocks the musk note, but he said it smelled a bit too fem for him.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="811075"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=811075#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1340769" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1340769" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PG01"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337422"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="PG01" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1340769ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1340769" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1337422">PG01</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-05-10">05/10/21 02:14</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Overhyped product by the Youtube community. I am confident Lush does the same ingredients body spray/perfume at a decent price point with better longevity than this product.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="3575"comment_id="1340769"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Gypsy-Water-3575.html?ccid=1340769#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="3575" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="search-reviews"><search-perfume-reviews :perfume_id="3575":random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]"></search-perfume-reviews></div></div><foundation-tabs></foundation-tabs></reviews-wrapper></div><perfume-shortcut-menu :perfume_id="3575" when-hidden="#toptop"></perfume-shortcut-menu><initialize-status-data></initialize-status-data><div class="cell small-12"><!-- Tag ID: fragranticacom_perfume_footer -->

    </div>
    <div class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 0.5em;"><span>Perfume Encyclopedia</span></div>
<div>Perfumes: <b>98,524</b><br/>
    Fragrance Reviews: <b>1,929,598</b><br/>
    Perfume lovers: <b>1,389,094</b><br/>

    }

<script  data-cfasync="false">
    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
        });
    }
</script>
